>>08cc981d-562c-4077-aab3-1f09cd9b5fcc
If you click the id hash underlined in red, you'll be given the option to mute whoever it was that created the board. If you click the board title underlined in blue, you will be given the option to blacklist the board, deleting all content from that board on your computer.

>>b8f747a6-c734-4485-a33d-a3e207ee07b6
Images are starting to load for me now. Also, considering you're dumping images, I've tested image limits. I've found you can upload 250+ images in a single post, didn't feel like trying to find the cap since at that point I don't think it matters. I've heard 50mb is the file size limit but haven't tested it myself.
Jim

>>ef8f6e98-67f3-4077-a4fa-991269772f32
>Are links incompatible if there's even 1 difference in muted users?
Haven't run into that issue **but I haven't muted anyone**, might want to bring that up with the BO. Muting users will change post numbers in a thread, so it makes sense muting and then unmuting someone might fuck up your replies when you link to a post.
salty
TAIWAN

There needs to be an 08chan etiquette guide for seeding/posting.  I can see the thumbnail in this post >>9d8026c4-f412-4bae-b12c-a29ea8b6d8ad but not the full image. First day there were no problems with viewing images on my end, but over the past 24 hours I'm getting more and more blank images or only thumbnails. If there is going to be a migration here, people need to know how to keep 08chan running smoothly. Smaller boards are going to die quickly if anons posting there don't understand that seeding images/videos/pdfs are the only way to keep a board alive. Not so much of a problem for /v/ and /pol/, but we can't forget about the smaller boards either.

>>209a3e24-77ab-4108-8aa1-7f53495642bb
>When/if the site gets updated, does that mean we won't need to use that workaround?
Depends on what the workaround is. As long as you have the this toggled, your version of 08chan won't be updated. If you were to use the workaround and 08chan gets an update, it would be better to see if the update worked before toggling the option so your version of the software is made up to date.

>Could I potentially wait until that happens?
Yes, I haven't seen the BO talk about any updates he is going to make though. He's mentioned stability being more important than anything else, so it may be awhile before he starts tweaking the site. Especially since we don't know if this is going to remain a bunker for the main site or if it remains fucked and people start migrating here.

>>5e99a71c-cee7-4f4a-bdb4-62fc87437035
Right now 08chan comes up short in a few ways. Millchan is made so you choose what boards you want to seed, acting like a whitelist so you're only distributing content you've chosen. 08chan was based from a previous version that doesn't have that functionality. Your choices are distribute everything or choose to seed as you lurk. I'd suggest you only seed what you come across unless you trust your opsec and want to distribute the entire site.

>>a04d39bb-c52b-4388-81de-a82ecb7d608e

>>904b1f19-eafa-4a63-9b4e-4d3edf5eec84
ID/certificate are the same in this case, click the [M] beside your post to find what your certificate is. For a new certificate, delete the users.json file in your ZeroNet folder. Next time you post you should have a new certificate.

>>67d00c41-9ab9-4227-8ac6-b6b83754230b
Click and hold button in top right corner, slide to the left. Go to size limit and set it to whatever you like. It will also tell you how many peers you're connected to, gives you a globe representing connections, and your upload/download ratio.

>>10402068-f58a-4bcd-8163-0266e0d62b7d
save your users.json file in your ZeroNet folder and keep it somewhere safe, your privileges as BO are tied to the identity address contained inside it and once you lose it you can't get it back.

>>f4731125-9189-40c0-b1b3-88b4525abc94
>Though how you'll know is the real question.
Alright, I fucked around for a second and found out how to see if what you've posted is being seeded
>right-click image name, save link as
>copy whatever string it gives you
>click button top right, will take you to ZeroNet homepage
>go to files tab
>paste string into search tab
>file comes up with number of peers/amount of data uploaded
I tried it on drawfag's image and saw there are two people seeding, but the icons are filled in with orange instead of green. I'm assuming this means someone is trying to seed a file but there aren't any peers to leech the file from.

Honestly shouldn't be this much of a hassle to see if what you've posted is being shared.
